company.name: Miniclip S.A.
company.business_description: Miniclip S.A. develops, publishes, and distributes mobile and online digital games. As of August 2019, the company had approximately 100 applications available for download through Apple's App Store and Google Play, with games also accessible via its website and Facebook.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Miniclip S.A., a Swiss mobile and online game developer, joined the CARU COPPA safe harbor program in July 2009, which certifies that operators comply with children's online privacy protections. CARU terminated Miniclip's participation in the safe harbor program on July 6, 2015. Despite losing its certified status, Miniclip continued to disseminate statements on its website and in its apps claiming it was a certified, current participant in the CARU COPPA safe harbor program through at least June–July 2019. These false claims appeared on Miniclip's Small Print page, Terms and Conditions page, and Facebook Games Privacy Policy page for years after the termination.

representations_made.description: Claimed to have been accepted into and certified as compliant with the CARU Kids Privacy Safe Harbor Program, posted on the Small Print website page
representations_made.quoted_text: In recognition of our focus on the quality and safety of our content, we have been accepted to join the CARU Kids Privacy Safe Harbor Program and have been certified as COPPA compliant.

representations_made.description: Claimed to have been accepted into and certified as compliant with the CARU Kids Privacy Safe Harbor Program, posted on the Terms and Conditions website page (and accessible in-app)
representations_made.quoted_text: 10. From April 2019 through June 2019, Respondent disseminated or caused to be disseminated the same statement in Paragraph 9 on its Terms and Conditions website page (https://www.miniclip.com/terms). In addition to being available on Respondent’s website, the Terms and Conditions also were available to users through the settings menu in Respondent’s apps.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be a Certified Participant of the BBB's CARU Kids Privacy Safe Harbor Program with information practices reviewed and meeting CARU standards, posted on the Facebook Games Privacy Policy page
representations_made.quoted_text: Miniclip is a Certified Participant of the Better Business Bureau’s, CARU Kids Privacy Safe Harbor Program: http://www.caru.org/caru.aspx?id=275582381. The information practices of Miniclip.com have been reviewed and meet the standards of the Children's Advertising Review Unit's Kid's Privacy Safe Harbor Program.

counts.title: COPPA Safe Harbor Misrepresentations
counts.representation: Respondent represented, directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it was a current participant in the CARU COPPA safe harbor program.
counts.fact: After CARU terminated Respondent from CARU's COPPA safe harbor program on July 6, 2015, Respondent was not a current participant in the CARU COPPA safe harbor program.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 14 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: Miniclip S.A., a corporation and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it participates in, is certified by, or complies with any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including the CARU COPPA safe harbor.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent membership, adherence, compliance, certification, endorsement, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory/standard-setting organization, including the CARU COPPA safe harbor
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the Children’s Advertising Review Unit (CARU) Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA) safe harbor.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order itself, deliver copies to relevant personnel and business successors, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.

requirements.description: Submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within 10 days after the effective date
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For five years after the issuance date, deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers/members, employees/agents/representatives with managerial responsibilities related to the Order's subject matter, and any business entity resulting from a change in structure; delivery must occur within 10 days after the effective date for current personnel, and before others assume their responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: B. For five (5) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees, agents, and representatives having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Page 2 of 5 Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of the Order from each individual or entity to which a copy was delivered, within 30 days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days, and thereafter submit timely sworn notices upon changes in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings, following specified submission procedures.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance report within 60 days of the issuance date identifying contact addresses, all business names and addresses, describing each business's activities, detailing compliance with each Order provision, and providing copies of acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance notice within 14 days of any change in a designated point of contact or in Respondent's structure (or any entity it owns or controls) that may affect compliance obligations, including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate subject to this Order
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding filed by or against Respondent within 14 days of filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: Any sworn submission must be true and accurate, comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, include the prescribed declaration language, date, signatory's full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed in writing, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not USPS) to the FTC's Associate Director of Enforcement, with the subject line beginning: 'In re Miniclip S.A., FTC File No. 1923129'
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Page 3 of 5 Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Miniclip S.A., FTC File No. 1923129.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 10 years after the Order's issuance date and retain each such record for 5 years, covering financial records, personnel records, compliance records, and representations about privacy program participation.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold
requirements.quoted_text: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records for each person providing services (employee or otherwise), showing name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title/position, dates of service, and reason for termination if applicable
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent regarding participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory/standard-setting organization, and all materials relied upon in making such representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent regarding Respondent’s participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful investigative means including undercover contact.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of receipt of a written request from a Commission representative, submit additional sworn compliance reports or other requested information and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview (interviewee may have counsel present)
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, without identification or prior notice; nothing in this Order limits the Commission's use of compulsory process under Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification Page 4 of 5 or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates on June 29, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation of the Order, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: The Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on

requirements.description: The Order terminates on June 29, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent date the U.S. or Commission files a federal court complaint alleging any Order violation (whichever is later), with specified exceptions for provisions terminating earlier, respondents not named as defendants, and complaints filed after Order termination
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on June 29, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.

requirements.description: If a complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules Respondent did not violate the Order and the dismissal/ruling is not appealed or is upheld on appeal, the Order terminates as though the complaint had never been filed, except it will not terminate between the filing date and the later of the appeal deadline or the date the dismissal/ruling is upheld on appeal
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on June 29, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
